acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from Botetourt County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Botetourt County was formed from Augusta County by an act of 1769 to take effect on February 13, 1770. Part of Rockbridge County was added in 1785.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Botetourt County (Va.) Public Buildings and Grounds, Alterations and Additions to Courthouse, 1917-1918. This series consist of a single folder containing nine blueprint sheets with specifications for alterations and additions to the 1848 Botetourt County courthouse by architect G. R. Ragen of Roanoke, Virginia. This redesign reversed the original interior scheme of the building and eliminated most of the original interior trim, including that in the building's wings. The courthouse was destroyed by fire in 1970.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged by sheet number.
